A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Where to begin. So Disney corrupted the essence of Star Wars with their numerous Marvel-esk timed jokes and shameless addition of kid friendly monsters so they can market toys for profit. Not a big deal at all. It's Disney\, and we all saw that coming. But the massive plot holes and lack of character development with a inconsistent (with episode 7) story is what killed the movie. If anyone comes to the defense of this poorly directed movie then please comment on these bullet points. •Numerous Forced jokes •Carrie fisher alive in the vacuum of space •why a 1.5 hrs of slow moving star ship chase •No back story on snoke •why more powerful AT-ATs can't hit a target moving in a straight line •How Yoda can use the force when he's dead but hasn't...ever •Why the rebel commander waited until half the fleet was destroyed to do a final do a kamikaze run. •Or how the imperial commander had an entire conversation with an x-wing pilot at the beginning of the movie. Entertaining his comical banter
